body: The docs I see for `start-stop-daemon` suggest that `-u` doesn't do anything with `--start` other than determine whether the process is already running.  To set the user ID under which the program runs, you use the `-c` option.  But there are probably multiple versions of `start-stop-daemon`, I don't know which one you are using.  What does your program do if you just run it without using either `start-stop-daemon` or `sudo`?
